topic.title: KopyKate.bit - Streaming Video Torrents on ZeroNet
topic.body:
## _KopyKate - Streaming Torrents on ZeroNet_
http://127.0.0.1:43110/kopykate.bit/
http://kopykate.tk/

## NEWS:
** - 10 new movies to choose from in both 720p and 480p. 10000's more to come by the day! **
** - Site is now available through a domain redirect on clearnet proxies. This is not to be relied upon, though! **
** - KopyKate.bit is the new namecoin domain. **
** - Site was just tested on smartphones. Turns out, it works on android, but not apple! **
** - New promo video on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tmNCfQDmab8 **
** - The more people view the videos, the more seeds.. so do share kopykate.tk as much as possible **
** - Site will use featured videos as main source of revenue. Featured videos must be free from obnoxious and malicious content. **
** - Enjoy! **

topic.title: Calexit - could it happen?
topic.body:
Now that nobody seems to talk about programming and filesharing on here anymore ... I guess we can talk about politics!

Anyway .. Calexit - what are your opinions of it? Could it happen or not?

In my opinion, I really think it could. Me and my mum were laughing our fucking heads off when Trump got elected.. anything goes these days, really .. anything is possible. America is doomed... .. but maybe it's for the better.

1_16w7UuJAHbt8YBa8zxHS7UFk9mq8Q5DpE4.body:
> [tkarita](#comment_125_1GervYZoP82e8X1Rgc4wyMkJY2zSsJuq8t): A more recent TPB backup is less portable... 1.6GB.  Nobody expects them to stay offline, so the smaller versions are difficult to find.

yep. 

Which in turn got me thinking.. maybe the site should enable people to download external, custom magnet libraries.

Sort all videos according to a tag hierarchy, perhaps. Sort them by popularity, so that the most wanted videos are easier to find .. but if you're looking for more harder to find videos, you can download other magnet libraries.

It's basically like a yellow pages.

Site currently is unable to play video files. This is because the site is refusing to load the new Java files that I added to the js folder.. siteSign refuses to sign these new java files, and also refuses to sign the content.json in the main folder.

Been trying to fix this all night, with no success. Just can't get my content.json to sign after changing the files inside the data folder ... no matter how many new sites I create. Extremely frustrating.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/123XVG3HV1q2mEjp15dEmrQk1ZGH4jTFgG/
Just updated the link to the site. Hopefully, everything should be in perfect working order now, ready for a fresh start.

Site is in full working order at this point. Got some friends who will help me mass-seed all of the popular videos soon, so it'll be good for movies shows, as well. There will be no annoying ads, no viruses, no waiting for downloads!

I've been doing lots of changes to the scripts lately, try to clear the cache. All videos are seeding now. 

**Remember that it's not working on Chrome.** Only works on Firefox. This is also the case for ZeroTube, and any site that uses the the WebTorrent script on ZeroNet. This seems to be an issue with ZeroNet's iframes, which means a lot of scripts that normally work on the web .. need to be re-written for use on ZeroNet, which is a pain in the ass.

There's also a bug on WebTorrent.desktop which causes torrents to randomly stop seeding. I've reported the issue to the creators, and they'll be working on it. The only work-around for that right now would be to have as many seeds as possible. 

Nonetheless, I'll be getting some friends to do some mass-seeding for me this year, at least until the site gets going. ;)

> [oracle](#comment_187_1ED3Ho3kmzaKiECtyuqSjDpoE47rKuXeP): Stupid question, do I have to install  Peerify and WebTorrent Desktop to use Kopy Kate?

No, just WebTorrent.Desktop. Peerify is just a site that allows you to upload files, and then get them temporarily webseeded, as well. This should help reduce the number of people losing their torrents and from creating dead video links that don't work. 

Gonna make some tutorials on how do web-seed your videos on WebTorrent, as well. This will help with 24/7 seeding. Stay tuned. ;)

4_1C6qdRAX8iYqSB7TfUxk91yW8Y2SBKNgfA.body:
Make sure these computers are all on a completely different network altogether, otherwise it won't make a difference.

Install ZeroNet on each of them and open up the sites, leave ZeroNet running. There's no need to log in with your identity to do this.

7_13Cqt2MSFS6eu4cbVuByZBuULrEAcZAqFG.body:
Hey there. Just to get the word out - so far, there's currently two video sharing site projects happening, which you might like to check out: ZeroTube and KopyKate. 

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FUQPLXHimgCvYHH7v3bJXspJ7bMBUXcEb/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/123XVG3HV1q2mEjp15dEmrQk1ZGH4jTFgG/

I had a look at your site, it seems like there's some issues with the content.json, but I'm familiar with this type of error. I'm also having trouble making sense of all the folders that have been added to my ZeroBundle folder .. it's too much data for a single site. What's going to happen the day your page becomes popular? Are users going to have to download a page for every one of the million channels available?

Having said that, there's a lot of things on the site that are brilliantly done, especially the video player and the channel pages. We really should all get together and work on a single site, but sometimes competition seems like the only path toward progress. lol

Are you using WebTorrent by any chance .. or are you just directly playing .mp4 files from a folder?

Either way .. so far, so good!

1_1LE1ngFyG62KJC1Q7G2xyZGjaB2QubXSi9.body:
pretty much. ^^

I think the solution to that would be to have multiple people who know the private key, all over the world .. and have a backup of the site on their hard drivers. It shouldn't be that hard to backup the database.. it's basically just raw text.

> [tkarita](#comment_155_1GervYZoP82e8X1Rgc4wyMkJY2zSsJuq8t): There are two experimental sandbox sites, where the private key is public.  It turns out that anything deleted tends to reappear when the next person signs, because deletions aren't published and everyone else still has the files.  Instead, content has to be overwritten to destroy it.

That's true for individual files only, I think.

When it comes to messages, such as here on ZeroTalk .. all the information is stored on data/users/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXxxx/data.json, which is constantly overwritten every time changes are published. All of your comments and topics are stored on that file.

Torrent sites work the same way on here .. most of which are clones of ZeroTalk. All magnet links are stored on the data.json files in the user folders, and once they're overwritten, there's no going back, unless somebody has a backup.

4_1MCsyW6W243LY69ZYm99XbV3M8Gbbrp5hF.body: I never understood the point of having to pay, in order to download torrents. If you're gonna pay to watch movies, just pay for a legal movie streaming site.

1_1F2PXhSgvJJvhpJzVmE2eEpgoUbDt4k1gk.body:
> [rythyrix](#comment_7_18eGWSaM3Vc9i61LVfogjQJf5gp7EN7b9Y): For ZeroTorrent, please embed site's banner logo in the zite's Zeronet content, not request from clearnet, even over HTTPS. It generates metadata that can be tracked, which is always a bad thing.

Where there is a will, there will always be a way for people to track you. The Pirate Bay is on clearnet, and millions of people are still using it without trouble.

People on here can be so paranoid sometimes - I find that it's better to just enjoy yourself and just stick with basic common sense safety measures.... such as, don't post your home address, your real name .. try to hide your IP whenever possible.. etc.

1_1JgHfDK4eojCkVZHKey9hiMAcAc9mxMUK2.body:
In reply to the commends below .. NullFolder is practically the same as Instant.io. There is absolutely no difference or greater benefit between using one, and using the other.. the javascript and WebRTC still works the same.

WebTorrent is the future, and is not going to go away anytime soon. WebRTC is also open source, and anyone who's bold enough and has the right amount of spare time will eventually fix the IP-leaking security flaw, so that in itself is no excuse to dismiss this technology altogether.

When it comes to Torrents, the main benefit of ZeroNet is _Magnet link storage. _ Every client is essentially responsible for storing these magnet links in their harddrives. You can't store magnet links in centralized servers, they're easy to take down. All the rest, such as the trackers and the torrent clients .. that has nothing to do with ZeroNet.

ZeroNet will never entirely replace the clearnet. ZeroNet is mostly a symptom of all the stupid censorship and non-sensical, outdated copyright laws we have in this world, although it does come with hidden benefits such as being able to host a website with little to no running costs. You won't need ads to fund yourself - people will power your website on your behalf using their share of their bandwidth.

Regarding ZeroNet apps, I can't really think of anything that has already been done, to be honest.. lol

Maybe a free Dating Site. Then again, the obscurity and anonymity of the network would certainly make people a lot of people feel unsafe. :p

Now that I think about it, people don't pay for dating sites because they're expensive to run - - people pay for dating sites, as a way of proving that they're serious about online dating.

> [phr34kz](#comment_22_1NGTMtN8816KeCtNqy6W4fCQduU4P8iwty): Dark Market. Better zeronet search engine and probably tons others besides just movies and tv series. I don't see Animes and whatnot. There's room for improvement and one that doesn't lead to content.js can't be download or index.html not found. Not everyone here has a seedbox nor have any time to webtorrent their videos to be streamed at KopyKate. 
> When it comes down to Dating Sites, think of the end users that's gonna use them, are they even savvy enough to even run ZeroNet? I doubt so let alone run this whole thing on their mobile.

Dark Market? You mean, along the lines of Silk Road?

That'll just attract law enforcement like a swarm of wasps. They'll come over pretending to be buyers, and then go on sting operations to track down drug dealers, or anyone selling anything illegal like guns, etc.

Also, seedboxes defeat the whole point of decentralization. 

They also defeat the whole point of torrenting movies. The whole point of using torrents to download copyright material is that it's FREE. Why pay for a seedbox, when you can just go legal and subscribe to a cheap online streaming service like NetFlix and watch all the movies and shows you like as soon as they're released? Or better yet .. go to the video store?

People these days .. lol

1_1ASFMANgCvtRUuZbz3GmxCsvRAJ4iHb6r2.body:
Copy the old folder from your previous computer, put it on a USB stick, then transfer it to the new computer. The easiest and best way to do it, so you can keep all of your sites as well.

The more complicated way to do it is to copy the Masterseed in Users.json, but even I have had trouble getting it to work .. not worth the effort, haha.

6_16w7UuJAHbt8YBa8zxHS7UFk9mq8Q5DpE4.body:
> [mynameislegion](#comment_16_1NAaF8VitwKSPo79RzJFhqz14gndmdWcGV): Have a look at the help guide, under user_contents:
> http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/site_development/content_json/
> user_contents
> Rules of allowed user content of current directory.Node     Descriptioncert_signers     Accepted domains and it's valid signer's addressespermission_rules     Allowed file names and total directory size based on cert domain or authorization methodpermissions     Per-user permissions. (false = banned user)
> Example:
>   "user_contents": {    "cert_signers": {      "zeroid.bit": [ "1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz" ]    },    "permission_rules": {      ".": {        "files_allowed": "data.json",        "max_size": 10000      },      "bitid/.@zeroid.bit": { "max_size": 40000 },      "bitmsg/.*@zeroid.bit": { "max_size": 15000 }    },    "permissions": {      "bad@zeroid.bit": false,      "nofish@zeroid.bit": { "max_size": 100000 }    }  }

Already looked at that actually, even tried adding it to content.json (in the data/users/ folder of my account) .. but it didn't work. :/

Do I add that whole block of code to the content.json of my username.. or just the section with the permissions? For some reason I can't find the User_contents in it.

Might just have to keep trying different combinations. Maybe there's a tiny detail I'm missing.

Thanks, either way. :)

Ok, actually.. that didn't quite work out. New comments fail to publish now.. my entire site is corrupted.. lol

Might have to start everything from scratch in a new link. Live and learn..

IMPORTANT: Never change the Zeroid.bit input in User_contents. It'll just cause all of your future content to fail publishing, for some reason. Just keep it as 1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz.

I could probably spend hours writing a Fool-proof ZeroNet guide. lol... there's so much information that is missing in the docs.

> [1984traveller](#comment_2_1Psc4YYyrL4T8gnPfQCTyh1b7kTuBuDAEY): BUMP!
> Error in signSite:Site:1BmDLy..2WPh content.json: Site too large 23216231 > 10485760, aborting task...
> Site:1BmDLy..2WPh Sign failed: Invalid content
> By: ZeroRandom: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BmDLy9bzNM33GuJCtwH1V5LN3KygH2WPh/

That is a huge site .. lol

It's very easy to increase the size limit of the site as a whole .. just go to the site control panel and set the new size limit. What's tricky is increasing the kb allowance of individual users.

Besides that, I find it very distracting.. especially while browsing folders and files. I wouldn't recommend it as a habit. Redbull is much better, and chocolate.

8_16w7UuJAHbt8YBa8zxHS7UFk9mq8Q5DpE4.body:
> [ulrichard](#comment_19_1PSaHi14Xh4Kjo3yyjDgbRtj4YLQgWV4QJ): Rather than use DRM, content creators could add a qr code for BitCoin donations to their work.Then people who like it could encourage them to create more of it.People who want to pirate can remove every DRM easily.But people who want to legally view content, but not on a Kindle or Netflix or whatever crappy bundle, are often left in the dark.The Brave browser is a step in the right direction, but there needs to be more of it.

The problem with donations is that most people don't donate, though. Otherwise, sites like YouTube and Facebook would have already employed that model of revenue. It's not a realistic way to pay the rent of small content creators.

> [nutomic](#comment_20_1FEikAyxCNPJcW996B69r5UFg29yfq579m): I don't know how you can believe that. Just look at sites like DeviantArt, Steam Workshop, Github or many others, to see how many people create content without receiving any money. I think most content creators do it primarily because they like it, and not for the money.
> Sure, if people don't pay for content, companies will earn less money from it, so there will be less commercial content. But that's a good thing, because it subverts corporations. Fuck capitalism!

So you support a Universal Basic Income like I proposed?

> [nutomic](#comment_22_1FEikAyxCNPJcW996B69r5UFg29yfq579m): I support socialism. Here's an introduction:http://monthlyreview.org/2009/05/01/why-socialism/

Socialism is a bit outdated though in my opinion. I say this as a Venezuelan who has left the country to start a new life in New Zealand. 

My proposal is to have a mostly libertarian society, no welfare, no subsidies, no bank bailouts. The only social safety net will be a Universal Basic Income, where all citizens are paid a weekly or monthly sum that will be enough to cover all of their basic survival needs. People will still receive this money regardless of whether they're working or not, so that means that the people who work, will receive both their work income, as well as the UBI. That in turn will increase work incentives, because people who work will always have more money than those who don't.. but it also means that those who don't work, won't be punished with poverty.
Torrenting and ad blocking are obviously not the same thing. I was referring to them in the context of loss of revenue, as well as loss of incentives for content creators to produce.

A Universal Basic Income will be paid for through taxation, though.. not charity. So that's mild socialism, in a way, but it won't affect the market economy as a whole. The sole purpose of the UBI is to eliminate Poverty, not to get rid of rich people.

Racist posts really aren't anything special, and decentralization doesn't make any difference. You're already allowed to post racist stuff on 4chan and on YouTube. I think that's what really annoys people here. .. they're not saying they want racist posts to be censored.. they're just saying they're annoyed by it .. and quite frankly, they have just as much of a right to express the fact that they're feeling annoyed as the racists have the right to post racist stuff .. lol

4_1FYXQGLBeNabf5jZHgP4CwzbmJSKaK4oMz.body:
It's already possible to delete posts on ZeroTalk, it's actually pretty easy. 

e.g. Copy the browser URL:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:4_1FYXQGLBeNabf5jZHgP4CwzbmJSKaK4oMz/DIY+workaound+for+blocking+the+spammers+and+crap+creators

After the '?Topic:' string you will find the Topic_Id which is
4_1FYXQGLBeNabf5jZHgP4CwzbmJSKaK4oMz

4 represents the topic number and the address next to it is the ZeroID address of the user.

You then go to your site folder > data > users > and look up this address, which is basically a folder. Inside this folder you'll find data.json. Modify this data.json and remove any topic and comments you want, save the file.. then go back to your browser, open up your ZeroNet site .. go to the menu on the right. Write this into the field where it says 'content.json' : data/users/1FYXQGLBeNabf5jZHgP4CwzbmJSKaK4oMz/content.json  ... and then click Sign and Publish.

Of course, you need to be the site owner to do this. If site owner doesn't want to deal with spam, that's his choice, and maybe its time to create your own site with its own rules.

10_16w7UuJAHbt8YBa8zxHS7UFk9mq8Q5DpE4.body: **UPDATE: KopyKate now uses TorrentMedia as the standard client for new film releases. This should speed up torrents significantly. TorrentMedia is better than WebTorrent.Desktop for mass-seeding, but it surprisingly works faster if it is minimized compared to Windowed mode. This might have something to do with the CPU and bandwidth consumption of certain Node.js modules. **
